isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - IC BUS SERVICE MANUAL - WINDOWS - INSTALLATION

svcproc.title: INSTALLATION
svcproc.para: To ease installation, the rubber gasket can be heated with a non-flame source (heat gun). At high temperatures, the rubber gasket is more pliable. Do not heat above 125°F for longer than 1½ hours.

Avoid contacting the glass with anything that may chip or crack the edges. Pressure on the glass will tend to concentrate at the chipped areas, causing cracks. If the glass is chipped, the edge should be ground smooth prior to installation.

step1.para: For large applications such as the windshield glass, install the rubber gasket onto the flange of the glass opening. For smaller glass applications, such as the entrance door, the rubber gasket should be located on the glass itself. See Figure 59.
Insert the hook end of the windshield glass installation tool into the gasket and work the glass into the opening.
To install the lace rubber into the rubber gasket, use the lacing tool by threading the lace rubber into the tool and installing the rubber. See Figure 60.
Pull the lace rubber around the rubber gasket, feeding the lace rubber into the tool using a hitching motion. This will help prevent the lace rubber from stretching.
A foam type glass cleaner or a mild soap and some water can be used to lubricate the rubber gasket. This will ease installation of the glass and lace rubber.
Inspect the installation and clean off the surface of the glass.
Seal the rubber gasket and glass with a pliable windshield sealant.
